00003 /**
00004  * The main class that controls the entire forum
00005  * and provides many useful utility functions.
00006  * This is where the magic begins :).
00007  *
00008  * @author Ryan LeFevre
00009  */
00010 class Osimo {
00011  public $user, $config, $ajax_mode;
00012  public $db, $cache, $paths, $theme, $debug, $bbparser;
00013  private $defaults, $allowOptMod, $globals;
00014  private $cacheOptions, $dbOptions, $debugOptions, $themeOptions, $disableDebug, $debugVisibility;
00015  public $GET, $POST;
00016 
00017  /**
00018   * Class constructor.
00019   * All of the parameters are set in config.php
00020   *
00021   * @param Array $options (optional)
00022   *  Array of options set in config.php.
00023   * @param String $siteFolder (optional)
00024   *  Site folder relative to the URL root set in config.php.
00025   */
00026  public function Osimo($options=false, $siteFolder=false) {
00027   if (!defined('SITE_FOLDER') && (!$siteFolder || empty($siteFolder))) {
00028    die("You must specify a site root!");
00029   }
00030   elseif (!defined('SITE_FOLDER') && $siteFolder!=false) {
00031    define('SITE_FOLDER', $siteFolder);
00032   }
00033 
00034   $this->loadIncludes(SITE_FOLDER);
00035 
00036   $this->paths = new OsimoPaths(SITE_FOLDER);
00037 
00038   $this->defaults = array(
00039    "debugVisibility"=>array(),
00040    "disableDebug"=>true
00041   );
00042 
00043   $this->allowOptMod = array(
00044    "cacheOptions",
00045    "dbOptions",
00046    "debugOptions",
00047    "debugVisibility",
00048    "disableDebug"
00049   );
00050 
00051   $this->parseOptions($options);
00052  }
00053 
00054  /**
00055   * Due to PHP's instantiation method, this init function
00056   * must be called after the Osimo object is created (which
00057   * is done so in loader.php. This function instantiates all
00058   * the other core objects required to make the forum run.
00059   */
00060  public function init() {
00061   $this->debug = new OsimoDebug($this->debugOptions, $this->disableDebug, $this->debugVisibility);
00062   $this->cache = new OsimoCache($this->cacheOptions);
00063   $this->db = new OsimoDB($this->dbOptions);
00064   $this->db->osimo = $this;
00065 
00066   $this->loadConfig();
00067 
00068   $this->user = new OsimoUser();
00069   $this->theme = new OsimoTheme($this->themeOptions);
00070   $this->data = new OsimoData();
00071   $this->theme->osimo = $this;
00072   $this->bbparser = new OsimoBBParser();
00073  }
00074 
00075  private function parseOptions($options) {
00076   foreach ($this->defaults as $key=>$val) {
00077    $this->$key = $val;
00078   }
00079 
00080   if (!is_array($options)) { return true; }
00081 
00082   foreach ($options as $key=>$val) {
00083    if (in_array($key, $this->allowOptMod)) {
00084     $this->$key = $val;
00085    }
00086   }
00087  }
00088 
00089  private function loadConfig() {
00090   get('debug')->register('Osimo', array(
00091     'events'=>false,
00092     'object_creation'=>false
00093    ));
00094 
00095   if (!isset($_SESSION['config'])) {
00096    get('debug')->logMsg('Osimo', 'events', "Loading site config from database...");
00097    $data = $this->db->select('*')->from('config')->rows();
00098    foreach ($data as $conf) {
00099     $this->config[$conf['name']] = $conf['value'];
00100    }
00101    $_SESSION['config'] = $this->config;
00102   }
00103   else {
00104    get('debug')->logMsg('Osimo', 'events', "Loading site config from saved session.");
00105    $this->config = $_SESSION['config'];
00106   }
00107 
00108   get('debug')->logMsg('Osimo', 'events', "Site config: ".print_r($this->config, true));
00109 
00110   define('OS_SITE_TITLE', $this->config['site_title']);
00111   define('OS_SITE_DESC', $this->config['site_description']);
00112  }
00113 
00114  /**
00115   * Used to require the presence of specified GET variables
00116   * and to check their data type if needed. If the GET variable
00117   * is present, it is pulled into the scope of this class after
00118   * the data checking is done.
00119   *
00120   * @param String $id
00121   *  The name of the GET variable.
00122   * @param boolean $numeric  (optional)
00123   *  Is this GET variable strictly a number?
00124   * @param String $redirect (optional)
00125   *  If GET variable is missing, where should we redirect? If
00126   *  false, then halt script execution.
00127   * @return Boolean representing the validity of the GET variable.
00128   */
00129  public function requireGET($id, $numeric=false, $redirect='index.php') {
00130   if (!isset($_GET[$id])) {
00131    if ($this->theme->page_type == 'index' || !$redirect) {
00132     $this->debug->error("OsimoCore: missing parameter '$id'", __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, __FILE__, true);
00133     return false;
00134    }
00135 
00136    header('Location: '.$redirect); exit;
00137    return false;
00138   }
00139   else {
00140    if ($numeric && !is_numeric($_GET[$id])) {
00141     if ($redirect) {
00142      header('Location: '.$redirect); exit;
00143     }
00144     else {
00145      $this->debug->error("OsimoCore: invalid parameter '$id'", __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, __FILE__, true);
00146     }
00147 
00148     return false;
00149    }
00150   }
00151 
00152   if ($numeric) {
00153    $this->GET[$id] = $_GET[$id];
00154   }
00155   else {
00156    $this->GET[$id] = $this->db->escape($_GET[$id]);
00157   }
00158 
00159   return true;
00160  }
00161 
00162  /**
00163   * Used to specify an optional GET variable while
00164   * still doing data checking if needed. If the GET
00165   * variable is present, it is pulled into the scope of
00166   * this class after data checking is done.
00167   *
00168   * @param String $id
00169   *  The name of the GET variable.
00170   * @param boolean $numeric (optional)
00171   *  Is this GET variable strictly a number?
00172   * @return Boolean representing the presence and validity of the
00173   * GET variable.
00174   */
00175  public function optionalGET($id, $numeric=false) {
00176   if (isset($_GET[$id])) {
00177    return $this->requireGET($id, $numeric);
00178   }
00179 
00180   return false;
00181  }
00182 
00183  /**
00184   * Used to require the presence of specified POST variables
00185   * and to check their data type if needed. If the POST variable
00186   * is present, it is pulled into the scope of this class after
00187   * the data checking is done.
00188   *
00189   * @param String $id
00190   *  The name of the POST variable.
00191   * @param boolean $numeric  (optional)
00192   *  Is this POST variable strictly a number?
00193   * @param String $redirect (optional)
00194   *  If POST variable is missing, where should we redirect? If
00195   *  false, then halt script execution.
00196   * @return Boolean representing the validity of the POST variable.
00197   */
00198  public function requirePOST($id, $numeric=false, $redirect='index.php') {
00199   if (!isset($_POST[$id])) {
00200    if ($this->theme->page_type == 'index' || !$redirect) {
00201     $this->debug->error("OsimoCore: missing parameter '$id'", __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, __FILE__, true);
00202     return false;
00203    }
00204 
00205    header('Location: '.$redirect); exit;
00206    return false;
00207   }
00208   else {
00209    if ($numeric && !is_numeric($_POST[$id])) {
00210     if ($redirect) {
00211      header('Location: '.$redirect); exit;
00212     }
00213     else {
00214      $this->debug->error("OsimoCore: invalid parameter '$id'", __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, __FILE__, true);
00215     }
00216 
00217     return false;
00218    }
00219   }
00220 
00221   if ($numeric) {
00222    $this->POST[$id] = $_POST[$id];
00223   }
00224   else {
00225    if (get_magic_quotes_gpc()) {
00226     $this->POST[$id] = stripslashes($_POST[$id]);
00227    }
00228    else {
00229     $this->POST[$id] = $_POST[$id];
00230    }
00231   }
00232 
00233   return true;
00234  }

00236  /**
00237   * Used to specify an optional POST variable while
00238   * still doing data checking if needed. If the POST
00239   * variable is present, it is pulled into the scope of
00240   * this class after data checking is done.
00241   *
00242   * @param String $id
00243   *  The name of the POST variable.
00244   * @param boolean $numeric (optional)
00245   *  Is this POST variable strictly a number?
00246   * @return Boolean representing the presence and validity of the
00247   * POST variable.
00248   */
00249  public function optionalPOST($id, $numeric=false) {
00250   if (isset($_POST[$id])) {
00251    return $this->requirePOST($id, $numeric);
00252   }
00253 
00254   return false;
00255  }

00257  /**
00258   * Used to pass options to modules.
00259   *
00260   * @depreciated This function is no longer in use by
00261   * any Osimo module and will probably be removed in
00262   * the near future. Instead, options are passed when the
00263   * module is instantiated.
00264   *
00265   * @param String $module
00266   */
00267  public function options($module) {
00268   if (!$module || empty($module)) { $module = 'osimo'; }
00269   $optName = $module.'Options';
00270   $args = func_get_args();
00271   for ($i=1;$i<func_num_args();$i++) {
00272    if (isset($this->$module) && in_array($optName, $this->allowOptMod)) {
00273     $this->$module->options($args[$i]);
00274    }
00275   }
00276  }
00277 
00278  /**
00279   * Loads all of the required includes for all of the modules.
00280   *
00281   * @param String $siteFolder
00282   */
00283  public static function loadIncludes($siteFolder) {
00284   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/osimo_module.php';
00285   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/osimo_dynamic.php';
00286   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/classes/user.class.php';
00287   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/classes/bbparser.class.php';
00288   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/modules/debug.module.php';
00289   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/modules/paths.module.php';
00290   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/modules/db2.module.php';
00291   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/modules/cache.module.php';
00292   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/modules/theme.module.php';
00293   require $_SERVER['DOCUMENT_ROOT'].$siteFolder.'/os-includes/modules/data.module.php';
00294  }

00305  public function category($args=false) {
00306   return $this->initDynamicObj($args, 'OsimoCategory', 'category');

00348  private function initDynamicObj($args, $Class, $file) {
00349   if (!class_exists($Class) && file_exists(ABS_INC_CLASSES.$file.'.class.php')) {
00350    get('debug')->logMsg('Osimo', 'object_creation', "Including {$file}.class.php in order to create $Class object.");
00351    include ABS_INC_CLASSES.$file.'.class.php';
00352   }
00353   elseif (!file_exists(ABS_INC_CLASSES.$file.'.class.php')) {
00354    get('debug')->error("OsimoCore: unable to locate class file '$file.class.php'", __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, __FILE__, true);
00355    return false;
00356   }
00357 
00358   get('debug')->logMsg('Osimo', 'object_creation', "Dynamically creating object $Class with arguments: \n".print_r($args, true));
00359   return new $Class($args);
00360  }

00364  /**
00365   * A pseudo-global data manager, this function
00366   * is most useful from within ajax-capabletheme files.
00367   * Used to store data within the Osimo object that can be
00368   * retrieved from anywhere without ambiguity or scope issues.
00369   *
00370   * @param String $name
00371   *  The name/index to use for the data.
00372   * @param mixed $set  (optional)
00373   *  If null, return the data at the specified index.
00374   *  Otherwise, set the data at the specified index to this value.
00375   * @return The specified data (if retrieving)
00376   */
00377  public function globals($name, $set=null) {
00378   if (is_null($set)) {
00379    if (isset($this->globals[$name])) {
00380     return $this->globals[$name];
00381    }
00382 
00383    return null;
00384   }
00385   else {
00386    $this->globals[$name] = $set;
00387    return true;
00388   }
00389  }
00390 
00391  /**
00392   * Used to validate the arguments used in an
00393   * OQL statement. Returns the formatted OQL array.
00394   *
00395   * @param String $args
00396   *  The arguments written in OQL format.
00397   * @param Array $allowed
00398   *  Which parameters are allowed to be set.
00399   * @param boolean $escape  (optional)
00400   *  Whether or not the arguments should be escaped.
00401   * @return The OQL formatted array.
00402   */
00403  public static function validateOQLArgs($args, $allowed, $escape=false) {
00404   $data = explode('&', $args);
00405   $final = array();
00406   foreach ($data as $arg) {
00407    $temp = explode('=', $arg);
00408    if (array_key_exists($temp[0], $allowed)) {
00409     if (
00410      $allowed[$temp[0]] == 'any' ||
00411      ($allowed[$temp[0]] == 'numeric' && is_numeric($temp[1])) ||
00412      ($allowed[$temp[0]] == 'string' && is_string($temp[1]))
00413     ) {
00414      if ($escape) {
00415       $temp[1] = get('db')->escape($temp[1], true);
00416      }
00417      else {
00418       $temp[1] = "'".$temp[1]."'";
00419      }
00420 
00421      $final[] = $temp[0].'='.$temp[1];
00422     }
00423    }
00424   }
00425 
00426   return $final;
00427  }
00428 
00429  /**
00430   * Utility function used to get the numbers
00431   * for a SQL LIMIT clause in order to restrict
00432   * data to a certain page i.e. page 4 of a thread only.
00433   *
00434   * @param int $page
00435   *  The page number to be viewed.
00436   * @param int $num
00437   *  How many items there are per page.
00438   * @return Array containing the SQL limits.
00439   */
00440  public static function getPageLimits($page, $num) {
00441   return array(
00442    "start"=>($page-1)*$num,
00443    "num"=>$num
00444   );
00445  }

00450 /**
00451  * Somewhat of a singleton class retriever,
00452  * it does not actually instantiate the class but
00453  * instead retrieves the single instance of the
00454  * specified class. This function overcomes strange
00455  * scope issues by being outside of all classes.
00456  *
00457  * @param String $class
00458  *  The name of the object to return.
00459  * @return The specified object.
00460  */
00461 function get($class) {
00462  global $osimo;
00463 
00464  if (isset($osimo) && is_object($osimo)) {
00465   if ($class=='osimo') {
00466    return $osimo;
00467   }
00468 
00469   if (is_object($osimo->$class)) {
00470    return $osimo->$class;
00471   }
00472  }
00473 
00474  return false;
00475 }

00479 function __autoload($class){
00480  $classes = array(
00481   'OsimoBBParser'=>'bbparser',
00482   'OsimoForum'=>'forum',
00483   'OsimoModel'=>'osimomodel',
00484   'OsimoPost'=>'post',
00485   'OsimoThread'=>'thread',
00486   'OsimoUser'=>'user'
00487  );
00488  $modules = array(
00489   'OsimoCache'=>'cache',
00490   'OsimoData'=>'data',
00491   'OsimoDB'=>'db2',
00492   'OsimoDebug'=>'debug',
00493   'OsimoPaths'=>'paths',
00494   'OsimoTheme'=>'theme'
00495  );
00496 
00497  if(array_key_exists($class,$classes)){
00498   $inc = ABS_INC_CLASSES.$classes[$class].'.class.php';
00499  }
00500  elseif(array_key_exists($class,$modules)){
00501   $inc = ABS_INC_MODULES.$modules[$class].'.module.php';
00502  }
00503  else{
00504   $inc = ABS_INC.strtolower(str_replace(' ','_',$class)).'.php';
00505  }
00506 
00507  include_once($inc);
00508 }
